CatDescriptText: Tom Passant, student, Forest Hills and Roland Smith, painter, Fifth Ward, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, May 21, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that racket squads eliminate vice and crime?" Mr. Passant's answer reads: "I think they do, however, I've not given the subject very much attention or consideration."  Mr. Smith's answer reads: " It helps to cut down rackets and makes it safer to live."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Tom Passant wearing dark jacket, dark shirt with anchor pattern, and eyeglasses, standing in front of buildings, including Mellon Bank; Portrait of Roland Smith wearing plaid button down collared shirt and hat, standing on sidewalk with First Federal of Pittsburgh building in background
